ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Unilateral utricular dysfunction
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: Specific deficit on DSVV testing (lack of tilt change with right utricular stimulation) consistent with symptoms during high-velocity leftward turns.

ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Migraine or small vessel disease
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: MRI showed nonspecific T2 signal alterations, though symptoms are highly specific to driving maneuvers.

ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Arnold-Chiari malformation
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: Low-lying cerebellar tonsils noted on MRI but malformation was excluded upon review.

ordered_list.rationale_short: Assess neural integrity and rule out retrocochlear pathology.
Evaluate horizontal semicircular canal and central vestibular function.
Assess saccular and inferior vestibular nerve function.
Evaluate VOR gain and phase at various frequencies.
Specifically assess utricular function via eccentric rotation.

expected_interpretations_by_visit.collective_interpretation: Audiometry and standard vestibular testing (VNG, cVEMP, standard Rotational Chair) were largely normal, ruling out cochlear, saccular, or horizontal canal deficits. However, specialized DSVV testing revealed a specific right utricular dysfunction, evidenced by a lack of subjective visual vertical tilt when the right utricle was isolated during eccentric rotation.

tests.name: Pure-tone audiometry
tests.result_summary: Normal hearing sensitivity at 250 to 8000 Hz bilaterally.

tests.name: Speech audiometry
tests.result_summary: Word recognition scores were 100% bilaterally; SRTs agreed with PTA.

tests.name: Auditory Brainstem Response (ABR)
tests.result_summary: Normal absolute latencies and interpeak intervals bilaterally.

tests.name: Videonystagmography (VNG)
tests.result_summary: No spontaneous/gaze nystagmus; normal oculomotor tests; caloric irrigations within normal limits (22% right relative reduction considered normal).

tests.name: cVEMP
tests.result_summary: Waveforms present bilaterally with thresholds at 90 dB nHL, implying normal saccular function.

tests.name: Rotational Chair (Standard)
tests.result_summary: Slightly decreased VOR gain with normal symmetry and phase; step velocity time constants normal.

tests.name: Dynamic Subjective Visual Vertical (DSVV) / Centrifugation
tests.result_summary: Centric rotation showed 3° right tilt. Eccentric rotation stimulating right utricle showed 0° change (abnormal). Eccentric rotation stimulating left utricle showed 8° tilt (normal).

proposed_items: Habituation driving exercises in a safe environment.
Limit highway speed to a stable threshold.
Repeated stimulating maneuvers with a driving instructor.
counseling_actions: Explain that the right utricle is not sending correct signals during high-speed left turns, causing the brain to misinterpret 'up'.
Reassure that hearing and the majority of the balance system (canals, saccule) are functioning normally.
Discuss how habituation exercises can retrain the brain to handle the conflicting signals.

escalation.rationale_short: Referral for habituation exercises to address specific utricular dysfunction affecting driving.

follow_up_plan.objective: Monitor progress with habituation exercises and return to comfortable driving.

expected_outcome: Patient participated in habituation driving exercises in a safe environment and limited her highway speed to a stable threshold.
Patient reported significant improvement through repeated stimulating maneuvers with a driving instructor.
